titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abbey Theatre records, 1910-1938

publicationstmt.publisher: The New York Public Library. Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

profiledesc.creation: EAD generated by archives.nypl.org on December 9, 2014

did.unittitle: Abbey Theatre records

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: This is a synthetic collection consisting of manuscripts, typescripts, correspondence, financial and legal documents, and a portrait.

bioghist.p: The Abbey Theatre in Dublin is an Irish theatrical company, founded in 1904 by William Butler Yeats and Lady Isabella Augusta Persse Gregory. J. M. Synge and Lady Gregory were its first directors. It is devoted to Irish drama.

custodhist.p: Some of the materials were among Ria Mooney's correspondence and with Lady Gregory's correspondence.

scopecontent.p: This is a synthetic collection consisting of manuscripts, typescripts, correspondence, financial and legal documents, and a portrait. The manuscripts and typescripts include stage directions, lists of actors, extracts of reviews of performances, schedules, and other matters related to the Theatre, as well as articles, notes, and reviews by Sean O'Casey, a lecture by Alfred Wareing, and addresses by W. B. Yeats, Lady Gregory, and J. M. Synge. The correspondence, dating from 1910 to 1928, includes letters from the Theatre to Sean O'Casey, Lady Gregory, and W. B. Yeats, as well as letters relating to the Theatre between various correspondents, including Sara Allgood, Annie Elizabeth Fredericka Horniman, and Bertha June Lucas. The bulk of the collection consists of financial documents, specifically weekly returns dating from 1920 to 1931, financial statements, and lists of checks made out to various payees.

prefercite.p: [Identification of the item]. The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, The New York Public Library.

acqinfo.p: This is a synthetic collection, created from materials acquired through gift and purchase from various sources.

processinfo.p: Processed by Staff; Machine-readable finding aid created by Lynn Lobash.

userestrict.p: For permission to publish, contact the Curator, The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, (212) 930-0803
